for_sales.sales_text: 17-ft classic gaff sloop built 1920 - 30s. Wooden hull, carvel built, larch on oak. Full restoration 2002-06. Mast and spars renewed then, also sails (James Lawrence). Long keel. Sails cleaned 2022. Running rigging renewed 2023. Cabin with grab rails. Can sleep 2, no creature comforts. Good inventory for day sailing: CQR and kedge anchors, warps, fenders. No electrics. Bracket for outboard. Option also to offer for 5 hp 4-stroke Mercury outboard. Insurance survey 5 April 2022 by AC Yacht & Boat Surveyors: condition “reasonable”. Hull now needs attention: it has been suggested to strip off all paint, possibly renew some skin timbers, inspect/renew caulking and stopping. Mainsail luff needs minor repair (cringles etc.). Trailer OK for yard work, not for highway. Length on deck 17 ft, with bowsprit 20 ft, beam 6ft 6 in, draught 2 ft 9 in. View by arrangement on hard at Brough, East Riding (premises belonging to Humber Yawl Club).

Small classic gaff sloop built 1920 - 30s. Wooden hull, larch on oak.

The vessel underwent a full restoration in 2002 -06, restored back to sailing condition. Mast and spars renewed then, also sails (James Lawrence). Long keel (filled with lead).

Cabin believed to be added pre-war, cabin roof renewed recently, grab rails added 2016. Can sleep 2, but no creature comforts. Good inventory for day sailing, e.g. CQR and kedge anchors. No electrics.

Insurance survey conducted 5 April 2022 by AC Yacht & Boat Surveyors: condition “reasonable”, minor recommended works (done or in hand) and, with regular maintenance, “the yacht may provide her owners with many years’ service”. 

Tohatsu 5 HP 2-stroke outboard.

Trailer serviceable for yard work, not for highway.

Length on deck 17 ft, LOA (length with bowsprit) 20 ft, beam 6ft 6 in, draught 2 ft 9 in. Displacement tonnage stated to be 2.25 tons. 

Purchased by her current owner, Nick Hall, York, 2015. May be seen on drying (mud) berth at Brough, East Riding (berth belonging to Humber Yawl Club).

boat.full_description:
Photographed at Bosham 1930s. Vessel bought by present owner 2015 from Heybridge, Blackwater, Essex.

Brought by road to York; by river to Brough 2017.

Safety equipment (jackstays, fire extinguisher) but no electrics. Compass. CQR and kedge anchors, with chain and warp.

Gaff rig with 3 ft bowsprit.

Wire standing rigging (forestay, shrouds x 2 each side). Traditional (probably hemp) running rigging and wooden blocks.

Small cabin with twin berths, just sitting headroom.

Outboard engine (Tohatsu 5 hp 2-stroke).

Survey April 2022 by A C Yacht Surveyors
